answers.answer: Pink,We are volunteers here and not physicians, so we can't give you a diagnosis.The symptoms you describe can be associated with uncontrolled diabetes, but only a doctor working with you & assessing complete blood work can tell you what's going on.  Since you're aware of troublesome symptoms, I encourage you to see your doctor soon.  If you can keep a 'log' of significant activities and how you're feeling, that can help the doctor also.It can be exhausting and emotionally draining to worry about what 'might be' going on, so please do check in with your doctor.  With an accurate diagnosis and then good training on how to care for yourself, you will likely begin to feel much better -- both physically & emotionally.If you are diagnosed with diabetes, please know you're welcome to come back here and we can also refer you to more individualized 1:1 support.  Good luck - and do get in touch with your doc soon.

question: I am noticing some strange symptoms. I have a mother and gradfather that had had type 1 diabetes. I have been noticing extreme hunger, extreme thirst, constant urination, irratable, and wieght gain. I know wieght gain isn't a common symptom but i have heard of it before. Do you think I have Diabetes?
title: I am very confused
